Expanding government & spending more of your tax dollars was a theme tonight but do any of the #DemDebate candidates have proposals to decentralize the Washington bureaucracy & give more power to the people?    More government is not the solution to every problem.

Bipartisan immigration reform is needed & that's why I have worked with both Ds and Rs to address this problem including funding for border security. Instead of far-left open border proposals we should act on these type of commonsense policies. #DemDebate

Candidates at tonight's #DemDebate want to eliminate the tax cuts that have led to increased wage growth investment in distressed communities record low unemployment and so much more. Dems don't seem to believe Americans want to keep more of their hard earned money not less.
Socialism will not help Americans. Instead we need to continue to pursue a free-market pro-growth agenda that unleashes American ingenuity. #DemDebate

This is a great country and both sides can come together on many issues but the Democrat party's lurch toward socialism is not the solution. Socialism is the new litmus test for Democrats and that is not good for our country. #DemDebate

Unfortunately we didn’t hear any #DemDebate candidates talk about issues facing rural America & how they would help these communities. We didn’t hear anyone talk about how to build on our current economic growth & institute policies that allow for more wage growth & new jobs.
#DemDebate candidates who want to kick people off of their health insurance is not what Americans want or need. Socialized medicine means higher taxes less choice longer wait times and worse care.
Gardner has Colorado’s best interests in mind. Read more in the @DailySentinelGJ opinion pages here 👉 https://t.co/hy1ny8yfl9 https://t.co/UZURuyFPd1
